description: Provides information about a specific message, including the from address, the subject, the recipient address, email tags, as well as events associated with the message. You can execute this operation no more than once per second.

parameters.name: MessageId
parameters.description: A MessageId is a unique identifier for a message, and is returned when sending emails through Amazon SES.

nested_items.name: MessageId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the message.

nested_items.name: FromEmailAddress
nested_items.description: The from address used to send the message.

nested_items.name: Subject
nested_items.description: The subject line of the message.

nested_items.name: EmailTags
nested_items.description: A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, that were applied to the email you sent, along with Amazon SES Auto-Tags.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message tag. The message tag name has to meet the following criteria:
It can only contain ASCII letters (a---z, A---Z), numbers (0---9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).
It can contain no more than 256 characters.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the following criteria:
It can only contain ASCII letters (a---z, A---Z), numbers (0---9), underscores (_), or dashes (-).
It can contain no more than 256 characters.

nested_items.name: Insights
nested_items.description: A set of insights associated with the message.

nested_items.name: Destination
nested_items.description: The recipient of the email.

nested_items.name: Isp
nested_items.description: The recipient's ISP (e.g., Gmail, Yahoo, etc.).

nested_items.name: Events
nested_items.description: A list of events associated with the sent email.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp of the event.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of event:

nested_items.type: If account-level or global suppression is being used, SES will still count it as a send, but delivery is suppressed.
nested_items.description: SEND - The send request was successful and SES will attempt to deliver the message to the recipient's mail server. (If account-level or global suppression is being used, SES will still count it as a send, but delivery is suppressed.)
DELIVERY - SES successfully delivered the email to the recipient's mail server. Excludes deliveries to the mailbox simulator, and those from emails addressed to more than one recipient.

BOUNCE - Feedback received for delivery failures. Additional details about the bounce are provided in the Details object. Excludes bounces from the mailbox simulator, and those from emails addressed to more than one recipient.

COMPLAINT - Complaint received for the email. Additional details about the complaint are provided in the Details object. This excludes complaints from the mailbox simulator, those originating from your account-level suppression list (if enabled), and those from emails addressed to more than one recipient.
OPEN - Open event for emails including open trackers. Excludes opens for emails addressed to more than one recipient.
CLICK - Click event for emails including wrapped links. Excludes clicks for emails addressed to more than one recipient.

nested_items.name: BounceType
nested_items.description: The type of the bounce, as determined by SES. Can be one of UNDETERMINED, TRANSIENT, or PERMANENT.

nested_items.name: BounceSubType
nested_items.description: The subtype of the bounce, as determined by SES.

nested_items.name: DiagnosticCode
nested_items.description: The status code issued by the reporting Message Transfer Authority (MTA). This field only appears if a delivery status notification (DSN) was attached to the bounce and the Diagnostic-Code was provided in the DSN.

nested_items.name: Complaint
nested_items.description: Information about a Complaint event.

nested_items.name: ComplaintSubType
nested_items.description: Can either be null or OnAccountSuppressionList. If the value is OnAccountSuppressionList, SES accepted the message, but didn't attempt to send it because it was on the account-level suppression list.

nested_items.name: ComplaintFeedbackType
nested_items.description: The value of the Feedback-Type field from the feedback report received from the ISP.
